Branch.TextExpression: ATTENTION! TSTC only applies to lesions less than 1.5 cm. Please select a different lesion appearance or an appropriate size. -tstc,size > 1.5

Choice.Label: Enhancing Solid Components (less than 10 to -10 HU)

cm is suspicious for renal cell carcinoma. If only an unenhanced CT has been performed, consider CT or MR without and with intravenous contrast. Depending on the outcome of that examination, recommend specialist consultation to consider management options.

cm is consistent with an incidental angiomyolipoma. However, growth is seen. Management depends on size and rate of growth.

The patient has symptoms that may be related to this lesion.

cm is consistent with an incidental angiomyolipoma. If the patient's symptoms or other findings (such as hematuria, flank pain or perilesional hemorrhage) could be related to this lesion.Recommend specialist consultation.
cm is consistent with an incidental angiomyolipoma.

The lesion contains an aneurysm >=0.5 cm.
cm is consistent with an incidental angiomyolipoma. Because the lesion contains an aneurysm >=0.5 cm, recommend specialist consultation to consider prophylatic treatment.
cm is consistent with an incidental angiomyolipoma.
Because the lesion contains an aneurysm >=0.5 cm, Recommend specialist consultation to consider prophylatic treatment.

cm. Some patients with multiple angiomyolipomas may benefit from an evaluation for tuberous sclerosis complex. Recommend specialist consultation to consider management options.

cm is consistent with a large incidental angiomyolipoma. Patients with angiomyolipoma>=4 cm should be referred for prophylactic treatment. Recommend specialist consultation to consider management options.

cm is a benign Bosniak category I cyst. Recommend no additional imaging or follow-up.
cm is a benign Bosniak category I cyst.
cm cystic renal lesion with a few hairline septa, without measurable enhancement, is seen in the
cm is a benign Bosniak category II cyst. Recommend no additional imaging or follow-up.
cm is a benign Bosniak category II cyst.
cm cystic renal lesion with multiple thin septa is seen in the

cm is a Bosniak category IIF cyst. Recommend follow-up CT or MRI both without and with intravenous contrast in 6 and 12 months, then yearly until 5 years from the first examination. If no change in imaging features (heterogeneity, contour, attenuation, or number of septa) during this time, it is a benign complex cyst and no further work-up would be recommended.
cm is a Bosniak category IIF cyst.

Recommend follow-up CT or MRI both without and with intravenous contrast in 6 and 12 months, then yearly until 5 years from the first examination. If no change in imaging features (heterogeneity, contour, attenuation, or number of septa) during this time, it is a benign complex cyst and no further work-up would be recommended.

The lesion shows morphologic changes (increasing number of septa, thickening of the wall/septa, or new nodular component) when compared to a prior study.

cm is a Bosniak category III cystic mass. Morphologic changes are seen compared to a prior study. Recommend specialist consultation to consider management options, including potential surgical resection.
cm is a Bosniak category III cystic mass.
Morphologic changes are seen compared to a prior study. Recommend specialist consultation to consider management options, including potential surgical resection.

cm solid renal lesion is seen in the

cm is consistent with a small renal neoplasm. Recommend follow-up, preferably with MRI without and with intravenous contrast, or CT without and with IV contrast, in 6 and 12 months, then yearly until 5 years from the first examination. If stable in size (growth of 3 mm/yr) and imaging features (heterogeneity, contour, attenuation, or number of septa) during this time, it is unlikely to be clinically significant and no further work-up would be recommended.
cm is consistent with a small renal neoplasm.

kidney is well-marginated and nonenhancing with attenuation above simple fluid.

cm is a Bosniak category IIF cyst. Recommend follow-up, preferably with MRI without and with intravenous contrast, or CT without and with IV contrast, in 6 and 12 months, then yearly until 5 years from the first examination. If no change in imaging features (heterogeneity, contour, attenuation, or number of septa) during this time, it is a benign hyperdense cyst and no further work-up would be recommended.
cm is a Bosniak category IIF cyst.
